etymologies: mid 18th century (in an earlier sense). Variant or alteration of amortization, probably originally after either post-classical Latin admortization-, admortizatio, variant of amortizatio, or Middle French admortisation, admortization

definitions: The action or an act of paying off a debt, liability, etc., gradually by making regular repayments over a period of time.

notes.text: Cent. Dict. (1889) records admortization as a variant of amortization but does not specify whether it was attested in both the modern and the historical sense.
